TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Group extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TaxonomyItem
Public NotInheritable Class Group Inherits TaxonomyItem

Docs.summary: Represents the top-level container in a object.

remarks.para: The object contains one or more child instances, and these can be accessed through the property. The class also provides methods for creating new child objects.Permissions for editing child and instances is specified on the group. The class provides methods for getting and setting permissions on the group, and for checking permissions.
The class also provides properties to get and set values of the object such as name and description, and enables the deletion of groups.
Additionally the class provides methods for checking changes on the object.
The class derives from the base class which provides additional properties such as and

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddContributor(string principalName) cil managed

Docs.param: The login name of the user to be added as a contributor
Docs.summary: Adds a contributor to the object.

remarks.para: Contributors have these permissions on the group.

Contributors can read, create, modify and delete instances and instances within the Group.The current user must have the TaxonomyRights.AddTermSetEditPermissions permission in this Group in order to use this method. Call the metho to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The user name cannot be found.
is null or empty
The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddGroupManager(string principalName) cil managed

Docs.param: The login name of the user to be added as a group manager
Docs.summary: Adds a group manager to the object.

remarks.para: Group managers have these permissions in the group.

Group managers can read and modify the group, and they can add or remove contributors from the group. Additionally they can perform all operations that a contributor can perform. The current user must have TaxonomyRights.ManageTermStore permission in the group to use this method. Call the to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The user name can not be found.
is null or empty
The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddSiteCollectionAccess(valuetype System.Guid siteCollectionId) cil managed

Docs.param: A property for the object that should be given access to the group.
Docs.summary: Adds a site collection to have access to its local site collection group.

remarks.para: Add a site collection to a group to enable it to access the local group. This method adds the requested site collection to the list that can access the gorup. If the group is not a site collection group, this method has no effect. The user must have permission to use this method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddSiteCollectionReadOnlyAccess(string siteUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL for the site collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a site collection to have read-only access to this local site collection group.

remarks.para: must be called in order to save changes to the database.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation. To use this method, permission or permission is required.
The group is not a site collection group.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ClearSiteCollectionReadOnlyAccess() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all site collection read-only access to this local site collection group.

remarks.para: must be called in order to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation. The current user must have the permission or the permission in order to use this method.
The group is not a site collection group.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Contributors As SPAcl(Of TaxonomyRights)

Docs.summary: Returns the SPAcl indicating the users who are contributors to the current object.
Docs.value: The SPAcl indicating the users who are contributors for the current object.

remarks.para: The SPAcl cannot be set directly.Any permission changes should be made using the and methods. Contributors or users who can modify the set of contributors can access this property. Specifically, the current user must have TaxonomyRights.AddTermSetEditPermissions permission or TaxonomyRights.Contributor permission to access this property.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TermSet CreateTermSet(string name) cil managed
Public Function CreateTermSet (name As String) As TermSet

Docs.param: The name of the new being created.
Docs.summary: Creates a new object in this object by using the term store working language.

remarks.para: The cannot exceed 255 characters, and it cannot contain any of the following illegal characters: ; " < > | & tab.

Additionally the must be a unique name within the current object.The current user must have TaxonomyRights.EditTermSet permission in order to use this method. Call the method to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.
Creating a term set in system Group is disallowed.
The name parameter is invalid. It either contains invalid characters, is too long, or conflicts with the name of an existing TermSet in the same Group.
The name cannot be null or empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Delete() cil managed

Docs.summary: Deletes this from the object.

remarks.para: The delete operation will fail if the object is not empty. The delete operation will fail if the object is the system Group.The current user must have TaxonomyRights.ManageTermStore permission to use this method. Call the method to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: A Group cannot be deleted unless it is empty and it is not the system Group.
The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DeleteContributor(string principalName) cil managed

Docs.param: The login name of the user to be removed as a contributor
Docs.summary: Deletes a contributor from the object.

remarks.para: The current user must have TaxonomyRights.AddTermSetEditPermissions permission to use this method. Call the method to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The specified user is not a contributor on this group. Deletion of this user as a contributor failed.
The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.

remarks.para: The current user must have TaxonomyRights.ManageTermStore permission to use this method. Call the method to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The specified user is not a group manager on this group. Deletion of this user as a group manager failed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DeleteSiteCollectionAccess(valuetype System.Guid siteCollectionId) cil managed

Docs.param: The property for the object that should have access removed for the group.
Docs.summary: Removes site collection access to local site collection group.

remarks.para: In order for a site collection to access its local group, it needs to be added to the group. This method removes the requested site collection from the list that can access this group. If the group is not a site collection group, this method has no effect. The current user must have the permission in order to use this method.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the description of this object

remarks.para: The description can be empty. The description length cannot exceed 1000 characters.The description cannot contain tab characters. Docs.exception: The description '{0}' is invalid. It probably contains invalid characters or is too long.

remarks.para: The changes returned in the collection include changes in the object and its child and instances. The collection returned may be empty.

Docs.summary: Returns the SPAcl indicating the users who are group managers for this object.

remarks.para: The SPAcl cannot be set directly.Any permission changes should be made using the and methods. Group managers themselves, or users who can modify the set of group managers canaccess this property. Specifically, the current user must have TaxonomyRights.ManageTermStore permission or TaxonomyRights.GroupManager permission to access this property.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsReadOnlySiteCollectionGroup As Boolean
public: property bool IsReadOnlySiteCollectionGroup { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that is true if the group for the current site is a read-only site collection group; otherwise, false

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSiteCollectionGroup As Boolean
public: property bool IsSiteCollectionGroup { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether this object is a site collection Group.
Docs.value: true if this group is a site collection group; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: A site collection group is stores the column-specific objects for a specific site collection.The Group.Name generally indicates the site collection that the group is related to. Calling set on this property is not supported and is for internal use only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSystemGroup As Boolean
public: property bool IsSystemGroup { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether this object is the system Group.
Docs.value: true if this Group is the system Group; otherwise, false

remarks.para: The system group is the group where objects that are used by the system are stored.An example is the Keywords term set.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Name { get; set; }
Public Overrides Property Name As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of this object.

remarks.para: There is a single Group name across all LCIDs, and this name must be unique within the object. The name cannot exceed 255 characters, and it cannot contain any of the following illegal character: ; " < > | & tab
The current user must have TaxonomyRights.EditGroup permission to set this property. Call the method to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.
Group names must be unique.
The name cannot be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or empty.
Renaming a system Group is disallowed.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SiteCollectionAccessIds As List(Of Guid)
public: property System::Collections::Generic::List<Guid> ^ SiteCollectionAccessIds { System::Collections::Generic::List<Guid> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a list of SPSite IDs that have access to the local site collection group.

remarks.para: In order for a site collection to access its local group, it must be added the group. This list of site collection IDs indicates the set of objects that have access to this site collection group. These IDs have no effect if this is not a local site collection group.
